---
title: new ddd
sidebar:
  order: 2
---

import OptionsTable from '../../../components/OptionsTable.astro';

The `new ddd` is a specialized command that inherits from the `new` command base class. It creates new projects
following the Domain-Driven Design (DDD) architectural pattern building 4 projects: Presentation, Domain, Application
and Infrastructure.

## Options

<OptionsTable options={[{
    name: '--name',
    alias: '-n',
    description: 'Project name',
    required: true,
    example: '--name MyDddProject'
}, {
    name: '--output',
    alias: '-o',
    description: 'The output directory',
    required: false,
    example: '--output ./projects/ddd'
}, {
    name: '--api-type',
    alias: '-api',
    description: 'API type (FastEndpoints)',
    required: false,
    example: '--api-type FastEndpoints'
}, {
    name: '--db-type',
    alias: '-db',
    description: 'Database type (MongoDB, EFCore)',
    required: false,
    example: '--db-type MongoDB'
}, {
    name: '--application',
    alias: '-app',
    description: 'Application layer type (MediatR)',
    required: false,
    example: '--application MediatR'
}, {
    name: '--domain',
    alias: '-dom',
    description: 'Domain layer type (Default)',
    required: false,
    example: '--domain Default'
}]}/>

> Omitting the `--output` option will create the project in the current directory.

> Omitting any other non required option will use the default value.

## Usage

```bash
apiand new ddd --name MyProject --api-type FastEndpoints --db-type MongoDB
```
